title: Extreme heat impacting V/Line train services from Saturday 9 March to Tuesday 12 March 2024
articleContent:
Extreme heat impacting V/Line train services from Saturday 9 March to Tuesday 12 March 2024

Travelling in Victoria > Regional Victoria

Hot weather is forecast for parts of Victoria from Saturday 9 March to Tuesday 12 March 2024. Extreme heat timetables will be operating across parts of the V/Line network.

V/Line will be implementing extreme heat timetables for the following lines:

Saturday 9 March

  • Ararat
  • Ballarat
  • Bendigo
  • Echuca
  • Geelong
  • Maryborough
  • Swan Hill
  • Warrnambool

Sunday 10 March

  • Ararat
  • Ballarat
  • Bendigo
  • Echuca
  • Geelong
  • Maryborough
  • Swan Hill
  • Warrnambool

Monday 11 March

  • Ararat
  • Bairnsdale
  • Ballarat
  • Bendigo
  • Echuca
  • Geelong (39°C)
  • Maryborough
  • Swan Hill
  • Traralgon
  • Warrnambool (39°C)

Tuesday 12 March

There will a partial extreme heat timetable implemented for the following lines:

  • Bendigo
  • Echuca
  • Swan Hill

Passengers are encouraged to check the extreme heat timetable for their individual lines and allow extra time for their journeys. 

Extreme heat timetables

View the extreme heat timetables, and allow extra time for your journey.
